70 enum EPrePostDestruction { PRE_DESTROY, POST_DESTROY };
71 
76 enum ERCPStrength { RCP_STRENGTH_INVALID=-1, RCP_STRONG=0, RCP_WEAK=1 };
77 
82 enum ERCPNodeLookup { RCP_ENABLE_NODE_LOOKUP, RCP_DISABLE_NODE_LOOKUP };
83 
85 inline void debugAssertStrength(ERCPStrength strength)
86 {
87 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
88  switch (strength) {
89  case RCP_STRONG:
90  // fall through
91  case RCP_WEAK:
92  return; // Fine
93  case RCP_STRENGTH_INVALID:
94  default:
95  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(true);
96  }
97 #endif
98 }
99 
105 template<>
106 class TEUCHOS_LIB_DLL_EXPORT ToStringTraits<ERCPStrength> {
107 public:
108  static std::string toString( const ERCPStrength &t )
109  {
110  switch (t) {
111  case RCP_STRENGTH_INVALID:
112  return "RCP_STRENGTH_INVALID";
113  case RCP_STRONG:
114  return "RCP_STRONG";
115  case RCP_WEAK:
116  return "RCP_WEAK";
117  default:
118  // Should never get here but fall through ...
119  break;
120  }
121  // Should never get here!
122 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
123  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT(true);
124 #endif
125  return "";
126  // 2009/06/30: rabartl: The above logic avoid a warning from the Intel
127  // 10.1 compiler (remark #111) about the statement being unreachable.
128  }
129 };

143 class TEUCHOS_LIB_DLL_EXPORT RCPNode {
144 public:
146  RCPNode(bool has_ownership_in)
147  : has_ownership_(has_ownership_in), extra_data_map_(NULL)
148 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
149  ,insertion_number_(-1)
150 #endif // TEUCHOS_DEBUG
151  {
152  count_[RCP_STRONG] = 0;
153  count_[RCP_WEAK] = 0;
154  }
156  virtual ~RCPNode()
157  {
158  if(extra_data_map_)
159  delete extra_data_map_;
160  }
162  int strong_count() const
163  {
164  return count_[RCP_STRONG];
165  }
167  int weak_count() const
168  {
169  return count_[RCP_WEAK];
170  }
172  int incr_count( const ERCPStrength strength )
173  {
174  debugAssertStrength(strength);
175  return ++count_[strength];
176  }
178  int deincr_count( const ERCPStrength strength )
179  {
180  debugAssertStrength(strength);
181  return --count_[strength];
182  }
184  void has_ownership(bool has_ownership_in)
185  {
186  has_ownership_ = has_ownership_in;
187  }
189  bool has_ownership() const
190  {
191  return has_ownership_;
192  }
194  void set_extra_data(
195  const any &extra_data, const std::string& name,
196  EPrePostDestruction destroy_when, bool force_unique );
198  any& get_extra_data( const std::string& type_name,
199  const std::string& name );
201  const any& get_extra_data( const std::string& type_name,
202  const std::string& name
203  ) const
204  {
205  return const_cast<RCPNode*>(this)->get_extra_data(type_name, name);
206  }
208  any* get_optional_extra_data(const std::string& type_name,
209  const std::string& name );
211  const any* get_optional_extra_data(
212  const std::string& type_name, const std::string& name
213  ) const
214  {
215  return const_cast<RCPNode*>(this)->get_optional_extra_data(type_name, name);
216  }
218  virtual bool is_valid_ptr() const = 0;
220  virtual void delete_obj() = 0;
222  virtual void throw_invalid_obj_exception(
223  const std::string& rcp_type_name,
224  const void* rcp_ptr,
225  const RCPNode* rcp_node_ptr,
226  const void* rcp_obj_ptr
227  ) const = 0;
229  virtual const std::string get_base_obj_type_name() const = 0;
230 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
231 
232  virtual const void* get_base_obj_map_key_void_ptr() const = 0;
233 #endif
234 protected:
236  void pre_delete_extra_data()
237  {
238  if(extra_data_map_)
239  impl_pre_delete_extra_data();
240  }
241 private:
242  struct extra_data_entry_t {
243  extra_data_entry_t() : destroy_when(POST_DESTROY) {}
244  extra_data_entry_t( const any &_extra_data, EPrePostDestruction _destroy_when )
245  : extra_data(_extra_data), destroy_when(_destroy_when)
246  {}
247  any extra_data;
248  EPrePostDestruction destroy_when;
249  };
250  typedef Teuchos::map<std::string,extra_data_entry_t> extra_data_map_t;
251  int count_[2];
252  bool has_ownership_;
253  extra_data_map_t *extra_data_map_;
254  // Above is made a pointer to reduce overhead for the general case when this
255  // is not used. However, this adds just a little bit to the overhead when
256  // it is used.
257  // Provides the "basic" guarantee!
258  void impl_pre_delete_extra_data();
259  // Not defined and not to be called
260  RCPNode();
261  RCPNode(const RCPNode&);
262  RCPNode& operator=(const RCPNode&);
263 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
264  int insertion_number_;
265 public:
266  void set_insertion_number(int insertion_number_in)
267  {
268  insertion_number_ = insertion_number_in;
269  }
270  int insertion_number() const
271  {
272  return insertion_number_;
273  }
274 #endif // TEUCHOS_DEBUG
275 };

419  template<class T>
420  static const void* getRCPNodeBaseObjMapKeyVoidPtr(T *p)
421  {
422 #ifdef HAS_TEUCHOS_GET_BASE_OBJ_VOID_PTR
423  return getBaseObjVoidPtr(p);
424 #else
425  // This will not return the base address for polymorphic types if
426  // multiple inheritance and/or virtual bases are used but returning the
427  // static_cast should be okay in how it is used. It is just that the
428  // RCPNode tracing support will not always be able to figure out if two
429  // pointers of different type are pointing to the same object or not.
430  return static_cast<const void*>(p);
431 #endif
432  }
433 
440  static RCPNode* getExistingRCPNodeGivenLookupKey(
441  const void* lookupKey);
442 
449  template<class T>
450  static RCPNode* getExistingRCPNode(T *p)
451  {
452  return getExistingRCPNodeGivenLookupKey(getRCPNodeBaseObjMapKeyVoidPtr(p));
453  }
454 
456  static std::string getActiveRCPNodeHeaderString();
457 
459  static std::string getCommonDebugNotesString();
460

463 };

466 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
467 # define TEUCHOS_RCP_INSERION_NUMBER_STR() \
468  " insertionNumber: " << rcp_node_ptr->insertion_number() << "\n"
469 #else
470 # define TEUCHOS_RCP_INSERION_NUMBER_STR()
471 #endif

479 template<class T, class Dealloc_T>
480 class RCPNodeTmpl : public RCPNode {
481 public:
483  RCPNodeTmpl(T* p, Dealloc_T dealloc, bool has_ownership_in)
484  : RCPNode(has_ownership_in), ptr_(p),
485 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
486  base_obj_map_key_void_ptr_(RCPNodeTracer::getRCPNodeBaseObjMapKeyVoidPtr(p)),
487  deleted_ptr_(0),
488 #endif
489  dealloc_(dealloc)
490  {}
492  RCPNodeTmpl(T* p, Dealloc_T dealloc, bool has_ownership_in, ENull)
493  : RCPNode(has_ownership_in), ptr_(p),
494 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
495  base_obj_map_key_void_ptr_(0),
496  deleted_ptr_(0),
497 #endif
498  dealloc_(dealloc)
499  {}
501  Dealloc_T& get_nonconst_dealloc()
502  { return dealloc_; }
504  const Dealloc_T& get_dealloc() const
505  { return dealloc_; }
507  ~RCPNodeTmpl()
508  {
509 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
510  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION( ptr_!=0, std::logic_error,
511  "Error, the underlying object must be explicitly deleted before deleting"
512  " the node object!" );
513 #endif
514  }
516  virtual bool is_valid_ptr() const
517  {
518  return ptr_ != 0;
519  }
525  virtual void delete_obj()
526  {
527  if (ptr_!= 0) {
528  this->pre_delete_extra_data(); // May throw!
529  T* tmp_ptr = ptr_;
530 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
531  deleted_ptr_ = tmp_ptr;
532 #endif
533  ptr_ = 0;
534  if (has_ownership()) {
535 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
536  try {
537 #endif
538  dealloc_.free(tmp_ptr);
539 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
540  }
541  catch(...) {
542  // Object was not deleted due to an exception!
543  ptr_ = tmp_ptr;
544  throw;
545  }
546 #endif
547  }
548  // 2008/09/22: rabartl: Above, we have to be careful to set the member
549  // this->ptr_=0 before calling delete on the object's address in order
550  // to avoid a double call to delete in cases of circular references
551  // involving weak and strong pointers (see the unit test
552  // circularReference_c_then_a in RCP_UnitTests.cpp). NOTE: It is
553  // critcial that no member of *this get accesses after
554  // dealloc_.free(...) gets called! Also, in order to provide the
555  // "strong" guarantee we have to include the above try/catch. This
556  // overhead is unfortunate but I don't know of any other way to
557  // statisfy the "strong" guarantee and still avoid a double delete.
558  }
559  }
561  virtual void throw_invalid_obj_exception(
562  const std::string& rcp_type_name,
563  const void* rcp_ptr,
564  const RCPNode* rcp_node_ptr,
565  const void* rcp_obj_ptr
566  ) const
567  {
568  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPT_MSG( ptr_!=0, "Internal coding error!" );
569  const T* deleted_ptr =
570 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
571  deleted_ptr_
572 #else
573  0
574 #endif
575  ;
576  TEUCHOS_ASSERT(rcp_node_ptr);
577  TEUCHOS_TEST_FOR_EXCEPTION( true, DanglingReferenceError,
578  "Error, an attempt has been made to dereference the underlying object\n"
579  "from a weak smart pointer object where the underling object has already\n"
580  "been deleted since the strong count has already gone to zero.\n"
581  "\n"
582  "Context information:\n"
583  "\n"
584  " RCP type: " << rcp_type_name << "\n"
585  " RCP address: " << rcp_ptr << "\n"
586  " RCPNode type: " << typeName(*this) << "\n"
587  " RCPNode address: " << rcp_node_ptr << "\n"
588  TEUCHOS_RCP_INSERION_NUMBER_STR()
589  " RCP ptr address: " << rcp_obj_ptr << "\n"
590  " Concrete ptr address: " << deleted_ptr << "\n"
591  "\n"
592  << RCPNodeTracer::getCommonDebugNotesString()
593  );
594  // 2008/09/22: rabartl: Above, we do not provide the concreate object
595  // type or the concrete object address. In the case of the concrete
596  // object address, in a non-debug build, we don't want to pay a price
597  // for extra storage that we strictly don't need. In the case of the
598  // concrete object type name, we don't want to force non-debug built
599  // code to have the require that types be fully defined in order to use
600  // the memory management software. This is related to bug 4016.
601 
602  }
604  const std::string get_base_obj_type_name() const
605  {
606 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
607  return TypeNameTraits<T>::name();
608 #else
609  return "UnknownType";
610 #endif
611  }
612 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
613 
614  const void* get_base_obj_map_key_void_ptr() const
615  {
616  return base_obj_map_key_void_ptr_;
617  }
618 #endif
619 private:
620  T *ptr_;
621 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
622  const void *base_obj_map_key_void_ptr_;
623  T *deleted_ptr_;
624 #endif
625  Dealloc_T dealloc_;
626  // not defined and not to be called
627  RCPNodeTmpl();
628  RCPNodeTmpl(const RCPNodeTmpl&);
629  RCPNodeTmpl& operator=(const RCPNodeTmpl&);
630 
631 }; // end class RCPNodeTmpl<T>

648  void foo();
649 private:

657 namespace {
658 // This static variable is delcared before all other static variables that
659 // depend on RCP or other classes. Therefore, this static varaible will be
660 // deleted *after* all of these other static variables that depend on RCP or
661 // created classes go away! This ensures that the node tracing machinery is
662 // setup and torn down correctly (this is the same trick used by the standard
663 // stream objects in many compiler implementations).
664 Teuchos::ActiveRCPNodesSetup local_activeRCPNodesSetup;
665 } // namespace
666

668 namespace Teuchos {
669 
670 
686 class TEUCHOS_LIB_DLL_EXPORT RCPNodeHandle {
687 public:
689  RCPNodeHandle(ENull null_arg = null)
690  : node_(0), strength_(RCP_STRENGTH_INVALID)
691  {(void)null_arg;}
693  RCPNodeHandle( RCPNode* node, ERCPStrength strength_in = RCP_STRONG,
694  bool newNode = true
695  )
696  : node_(node), strength_(strength_in)
697  {
698 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
699  TEUCHOS_ASSERT(node);
700 #endif
701  bind();
702 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
703  // Add the node if this is the first RCPNodeHandle to get it. We have
704  // to add it because unbind() will call the remove_RCPNode(...) function
705  // and it needs to match when node tracing is on from the beginning.
706  if (RCPNodeTracer::isTracingActiveRCPNodes() && newNode)
707  {
708  std::ostringstream os;
709  os << "{T=Unknown, ConcreteT=Unknown, p=Unknown,"
710  << " has_ownership="<<node_->has_ownership()<<"}";
711  RCPNodeTracer::addNewRCPNode(node_, os.str());
712  }
713 #endif
714  }
715 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
716 
717  template<typename T>
718  RCPNodeHandle(RCPNode* node, T *p, const std::string &T_name,
719  const std::string &ConcreteT_name, const bool has_ownership_in,
720  ERCPStrength strength_in = RCP_STRONG
721  )
722  : node_(node), strength_(strength_in)
723  {
724  TEUCHOS_ASSERT(strength_in == RCP_STRONG); // Can't handle weak yet!
725  TEUCHOS_ASSERT(node_);
726  bind();
727  if (RCPNodeTracer::isTracingActiveRCPNodes()) {
728  std::ostringstream os;
729  os << "{T="<<T_name<<", ConcreteT="<< ConcreteT_name
730  <<", p="<<static_cast<const void*>(p)
731  <<", has_ownership="<<has_ownership_in<<"}";
732  RCPNodeTracer::addNewRCPNode(node_, os.str());
733  }
734  }
735 #endif // TEUCHOS_DEBUG
736 
737  RCPNodeHandle(const RCPNodeHandle& node_ref)
738  : node_(node_ref.node_), strength_(node_ref.strength_)
739  {
740  bind();
741  }
743  void swap( RCPNodeHandle& node_ref )
744  {
745  std::swap(node_ref.node_, node_);
746  std::swap(node_ref.strength_, strength_);
747  }
749  RCPNodeHandle& operator=(const RCPNodeHandle& node_ref)
750  {
751  // Assignment to self check: Note, We don't need to do an assigment to
752  // self check here because such a check is already done in the RCP and
753  // ArrayRCP classes.
754  // Take care of this's existing node and object
755  unbind(); // May throw in some cases
756  // Assign the new node
757  node_ = node_ref.node_;
758  strength_ = node_ref.strength_;
759  bind();
760  // Return
761  return *this;
762  }
764  ~RCPNodeHandle()
765  {
766  unbind();
767  }
769  RCPNodeHandle create_weak() const
770  {
771  if (node_) {
772  return RCPNodeHandle(node_, RCP_WEAK, false);
773  }
774  return RCPNodeHandle();
775  }
777  RCPNodeHandle create_strong() const
778  {
779  if (node_) {
780  return RCPNodeHandle(node_, RCP_STRONG, false);
781  }
782  return RCPNodeHandle();
783  }
785  RCPNode* node_ptr() const
786  {
787  return node_;
788  }
790  bool is_node_null() const
791  {
792  return node_==0;
793  }
795  bool is_valid_ptr() const
796  {
797  if (node_)
798  return node_->is_valid_ptr();
799  return true; // Null is a valid ptr!
800  }
802  bool same_node(const RCPNodeHandle &node2) const
803  {
804  return node_ == node2.node_;
805  }
807  int strong_count() const
808  {
809  if (node_)
810  return node_->strong_count();
811  return 0;
812  }
814  int weak_count() const
815  {
816  if (node_)
817  return node_->weak_count();
818  return 0;
819  }
821  int total_count() const
822  {
823  if (node_)
824  return node_->strong_count() + node_->weak_count();
825  return 0;
826  }
828  int count() const
829  {
830  if (node_)
831  return node_->strong_count();
832  return 0;
833  }
835  ERCPStrength strength() const
836  {
837  return strength_;
838  }
840  void has_ownership(bool has_ownership_in)
841  {
842  if (node_)
843  node_->has_ownership(has_ownership_in);
844  }
846  bool has_ownership() const
847  {
848  if (node_)
849  return node_->has_ownership();
850  return false;
851  }
853  void set_extra_data(
854  const any &extra_data, const std::string& name,
855  EPrePostDestruction destroy_when, bool force_unique
856  )
857  {
858  debug_assert_not_null();
859  node_->set_extra_data(extra_data, name, destroy_when, force_unique);
860  }
862  any& get_extra_data( const std::string& type_name,
863  const std::string& name
864  )
865  {
866  debug_assert_not_null();
867  return node_->get_extra_data(type_name, name);
868  }
870  const any& get_extra_data( const std::string& type_name,
871  const std::string& name
872  ) const
873  {
874  return const_cast<RCPNodeHandle*>(this)->get_extra_data(type_name, name);
875  }
877  any* get_optional_extra_data(
878  const std::string& type_name, const std::string& name
879  )
880  {
881  debug_assert_not_null();
882  return node_->get_optional_extra_data(type_name, name);
883  }
885  const any* get_optional_extra_data(
886  const std::string& type_name, const std::string& name
887  ) const
888  {
889  return const_cast<RCPNodeHandle*>(this)->get_optional_extra_data(type_name, name);
890  }
892  void debug_assert_not_null() const
893  {
894 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
895  if (!node_)
896  throw_null_ptr_error(typeName(*this));
897 #endif
898  }
900  template<class RCPType>
901  void assert_valid_ptr(const RCPType& rcp_obj) const
902  {
903  if (!node_)
904  return; // Null is a valid pointer!
905  if (!is_valid_ptr()) {
906  node_->throw_invalid_obj_exception( typeName(rcp_obj),
907  this, node_, rcp_obj.access_private_ptr() );
908  }
909  }
911  template<class RCPType>
912  void debug_assert_valid_ptr(const RCPType& rcp_obj) const
913  {
914 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
915  assert_valid_ptr(rcp_obj);
916 #endif
917  }
918 #ifdef TEUCHOS_DEBUG
919  const void* get_base_obj_map_key_void_ptr() const
920  {
921  if (node_)
922  return node_->get_base_obj_map_key_void_ptr();
923  return 0;
924  }
925 #endif
926 private:
927  RCPNode *node_;
928  ERCPStrength strength_;
929  inline void bind()
930  {
931  if (node_)
932  node_->incr_count(strength_);
933  }
934  inline void unbind()
935  {
936  // Optimize this implementation for count > 1
937  if (node_ && node_->deincr_count(strength_)==0) {
938  // If we get here, the reference count has gone to 0 and something
939  // interesting is going to happen. In this case, we need to
940  // reincrement the count back to 1 and call the more complex function
941  // that will either delete the object or delete the node.
942  node_->incr_count(strength_);
943  unbindOne();
944  }
945  // If we get here, either node_==0 or the count is still greater than 0.
946  // In this case, nothing interesting is going to happen so we are done!
947  }
948  void unbindOne(); // Provides the "strong" guarantee!
949 
950 };
951 
952 
957 inline
958 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const RCPNodeHandle& node)
959 {
960  return (out << node.node_ptr());
961 }
962 
963 
973 class TEUCHOS_LIB_DLL_EXPORT RCPNodeThrowDeleter {
974 public:
976  RCPNodeThrowDeleter(RCPNode *node)
977  : node_(node)
978  {}
984  ~RCPNodeThrowDeleter()
985  {
986  if (node_) {
987  node_->has_ownership(false); // Avoid actually deleting ptr_
988  node_->delete_obj(); // Sets the pointer ptr_=0 to allow RCPNode delete
989  delete node_;
990  }
991  }
993  RCPNode* get() const
994  {
995  return node_;
996  }
998  void release()
999  {
1000  node_ = 0;
1001  }
1002 private:
1003  RCPNode *node_;
1004  RCPNodeThrowDeleter(); // Not defined
1005  RCPNodeThrowDeleter(const RCPNodeThrowDeleter&); // Not defined
1006  RCPNodeThrowDeleter& operator=(const RCPNodeThrowDeleter&); // Not defined
1007 };
1008

1022  {RCPNodeTracer::setTracingActiveRCPNodes(false);}
1023 };
